== Main Inclusion Report for python-openid ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/python-openid]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures.
# ''Rationale:''
** Required for the canonical-application-support specification.
0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=python-openid|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=python-openid|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** No daemons but users can create their own daemons from the library
** No network activity as is but due to the nature of the library it does do network activity.
** It directly (not through a library) processes structured data.
** No source code review performed
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** The package should always work out of the box.
** No debconf questions asked.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:python-openid|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/p/python-oepnid.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm.
** <nowiki>[[http://openidenabled.com/python-openid/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is calm.
** <nowiki>[[http://trac.openidenabled.com/trac/report/1|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>.
** No special hardware is needed.
** There is a testsuite in the upstream testsuite but it is not enabled in the package.
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant.
** Packaging system (debhelper/cdbs/dbs) ?  Patch system ?  Any packaging oddities ?
0. ''Dependencies:''
** debhelper, python, python-support
** All are in main.
0. ''Maintenance:''
** python-openid is a relatively simple package that is maintained in debian, however the Ubuntu Server Team will be taking care of it.
